c:change.summary: Initial version
Depend on jexternals for eclipse users
MatrixM3x3F allocated too many bytes (wasted memory)
Add SunOS supported
Correct build.xml to produce a jar file with the right version
Switch to maven for builds
ApproximatelyEqual* moved to io7m-jaux
VectorI*.zero renamed to ZERO and implemented by all vector types
MatrixM4x4D.multiply -> MatrixM4x4D.multiplyVector4DWithContext
MatrixM4x4D.multiply -> MatrixM4x4D.multiplyVector4D
Increase test coverage for integer vectors
Add Matrix3x3* makeTranslation functions
Add integer vector methods for Matrix4x4*
Rename methods to indicate the type of vectors used, removing ambiguity. All VectorReadable* interfaces are affected, as well as Matrix* methods that previously specified a type name.
Produce documentation with Maven
Make dependencies more honest: The package only depends on jsr305, not all of findbugs
Update all POM plugins to the latest versions
Improve documentation
Add missing documentation CSS
Use io7m-jaux 2.3.0
Use JSR 305 annotations to document concurrency properties
Change method names for consistency, deprecate old names (does not break compatibility)
Add MatrixReadable* interfaces
Update saxon-plugin to 1.1.0 to correct documentation builds on Windows
Add Quaternion classes for 3D rotations
Remove all @Deprecated methods from 2.3.0
Large javadoc updates and increased use of JSR 305 annotations (@Nonnull)

All classes now provide a hashCode() and equals() implementation. This may break code that assumes java.lang.Object()'s hashCode() or equals() method is used, but should give more consistent behaviour with regards to the contents of vectors and matrices.

Fix serious API mistake: The JRE will allocate new read-only buffers with asReadOnlyBuffer(). The floatBuffer() and doubleBuffer() methods of matrices no longer guarantee read-only semantics, as this requires expensive reallocations.
Make every matrix operation rewind the buffer that backs the matrix. This was a problem revealed by the API change in 4.0.0
Add all missing Vector* functions - VectorM* and VectorI* now have feature parity
Massive overhaul of test suite
All approximatelyEqual* functions have been removed; use almostEqual instead as it gives far more accurate results
MatrixReadable* functions renamed to make the row types explicit
Most quaternion functions that took or returned single precision floats now take/return double precision values
Quaternion*.makeRotationMatrix() renamed to makeRotationMatrix4x4 and added 3x3 variant

All single precision matrix and vector types now use double precision calculations internally for increased accuracy. Most functions that took floats as arguments now take doubles. The vectors and matrices are still using single precision float storage, so this should not break any existing code.
Add row fetching methods to all MatrixReadable* interfaces
Vastly improve documentation. Document all notational, semantic, and storage conventions.
Switch to using a consistent right-handed coordinate system throughout the package. This is a non backwards-compatible change.
Add Matrix*.lookAt()
Add Matrix3x3*.rotate() and makeRotation()
Add Quaternion*.lookAt()
Add Quaternion*.makeFromMatrix()
Add Matrix*.trace()
Add Vector*.orthoNormalize()

Modify the type of QuaternionM4{D,F}.copy() to allow any readable quaternion, as opposed to only QuaternionM4{F,D}. This change does not affect backwards-compatibility as it is simply a generalization of the type in question and cannot break existing programs.

All vector, matrix, and quaternion types are now non-final (however all methods are still final). This is to make it possible to make semantically distinct values type-incompatible via subclassing and/or the addition of phantom type parameters. See documentation.
Add three-vector orthonormalization (OrthonormalizedI3D, OrthonormalizedI3F).
Correct the type of VectorI*.ZERO - do not use the less-specific "Readable" type.
Correct documentation for vector subtraction.
Make the Orthonormalized structures take readable vectors.
Add long integer vectors.
Break dependency on jaux. Now depends on jnull, jfunctional, jequality, jintegers.
Make *Unsafe vector functions that were accidentally public, private.
Add VectorWritable* types.
Break package up into standard core and documentation packages.
Make vector fields private. Replace field access with getters and setters.
Correct dependencies: 6.0.0 was accidentally released with pre-release version dependencies (all of which are binary compatible with the current versions).
Migrate to GitHub.
Fix JavaDoc to cope with Java 8's doclint.
Add quickcheck generators.
Add functions to convert quaternions to axis/angle representations.
The packaged jar is now an OSGi bundle.
The package will no longer compile on JDK 6 due to Checkstyle, but the compiled code is still JDK 6 compatible.
Add heap-array allocated matrix types.
Add buffered vector and matrix types for addressing values that are packed inside large shared ByteBuffers.
Rename all Context* types to behave more pleasantly with unqualified imports.
All vector functions that allocated temporary objects now take re-usable preallocated Context values in the same manner as matrix functions.
Replace most direct uses of mutable vector types with generics and interfaces. This allows for code sharing between a selection of new vector types.
Add explicitly type-indexed vectors (PVector*).
Make all types final again, undoing the change made in 5.1.0 to support type indices.
Remove get() methods from matrix types and only allow element access via the MatrixReadable* interfaces.
Improve formatting of matrix toString() methods slightly.
Remove floatBuffer() and doubleBuffer() methods and only allow access to buffers via the new MatrixDirectBuffered* interfaces.
Correct javadoc comments to pass Java 8's new Javadoc doclint.
Remove Matrix*.translate* functions due to questions of correctness. Use r = Matrix*.makeTranslation* and multiply m * r instead.
Remove imperative Matrix*.rotate* functions to reduce the size of the API. Use r = Matrix*.makeRotation* and multiply m * r instead.
Add spherical linear interpolation for quaternions.
Switch to generating sources. This adds deprecations to various methods (see the japicmp report).
Use the japicmp-maven-plugin to enforce semantic versioning for future releases.
Complete rewrite. See japicmp report for changes.
Add vector distance methods.
Add bilinear interpolation methods.
All modules are now Java 9 modules. JDK 9 is now required.
Removed dependency on com.io7m.jnull.
Migrate to JUnit 5
Add element-wise multiplication
Require JDK 11 and Java 11 at run-time
